_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



COMPANY OVERVIEW

Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a number of U.S. industries.  Univar Solutions USA Inc. supplies the water and waste treatment market, food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil and gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with the chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products used in numerous end-use markets.

 

Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a member of the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health and safety improvement initiative.

 

Some of the products stored and handled by Univar Solutions USA Inc. are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein.  The contents of the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.



CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH

1. Prevention Program

Processes that are subject to OSHA's Process Safety management (PSM) standard AND are regulated under EPA's RMP rule are subject to the Program 3 Prevention program.  Univar Solutions USA Inc. has documented the Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual.  Briefly, this program includes provisions and requirements for:



* Process Safety Information

* Process Hazard Analysis

* Operating Procedures

* Training

* Mechanical Integrity

* Management of Change

* Pre-Startup Review

* Compliance Audits

* Incident Investigation

* Employee Participation

* Hot Work permits

* Contractors



2. Emergency Response Approach

Univar Solutions USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency Plan in place.  This Plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to Univar Solutions USA Inc. facility personnel.  Univar Solutions USA Inc.

responds to minor incidents but, will call in professional emergency responders such as Chlorep in the event of non-minor incidents.

Univar Solutions USA Inc. invites and encourages local emergency responders such as the fire department to visit and familiarize themselves with Univar Solutions USA Inc. products and facilities.



STATIONARY SOURCE

The Bunola Pennsylvania site stores, handles and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers in Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Ohio and New York.  The site handles Chlorine, 30% Aqueous Ammonia Solution and Sulfur Dioxide above the RMP threshold planning quantity.  The RMP Plan was revised in July 2017 to remove chlorine repackaging.



GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

As outlined previously, Univar Solutions USA Inc. is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.



Chemical-specific prevention steps include the following:

1. Employee training and operating procedures.

2. Mechanical integrity program.

3. Employee release detection and mitigation activities.

4. Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines  



ACCIDENT HISTORY

The site has experienced no accidents as specified in 40 CFR Part 68 as related to the handling of chlorine, aqueous ammonia solution 30% and sulfur dioxide in the previous 5 years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

An emergency contingency plan has been prepared and made available to local emergency response agencies. Allegheny County Emergency Planning Committee is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified. In addition, an agreement has been formalized with Weavertown Environmental Inc. and SPSI Inc.,emergency response contractors, to provide on site and off site emergency response services in the event of a release.



REVISION

S



This RMP Plan was submitted as a correction on September 3, 2019. The reason for correction was to update the company name and email domain name in Section 1 and this Executive Summary from Univar USA Inc. to Univar Solutions USA Inc.  In late February 2019, Univar USA Inc. purchased the assets of Nexeo Solutions LLC.  Effective September 1, 2019, the assets of Nexeo Solutions LLC were transferred to Univar USA Inc. and the legal name of Univar USA Inc. changed to Univar Solutions USA Inc. There was no material change in the day-to-day operations and personnel overseeing compliance under the above referenced facility. The purchase of Nexeo Solutions LLC's assets and company name change do not constitute a transfer of ownership for the above referenced facility address.
